choices.answer: An extreme pull from the gravity of the Sun
Something that happens to the ocean every two days
A cyclical pattern of temperatures in seas and oceans
The daily or twice daily rise and fall of the oceans

questions.question: What is the moon's role in causing tides?

choices.answer: Its phases make the tides rise and fall
Its gravity causes the water level on Earth to change
Its inertia works with its craters to make tides
It has no affect at all on Earth's tides

questions.question: On which side of the Earth do high tides occur?

choices.answer: The sides closest to and farthest away from the moon
At the equator and at the poles
Only the sides that are closest to the moon
Only the sides that are farthest away from the moon
Tides are caused by the temperature
By the gravitational pull of the moon and sun on the ocean
Tides are caused by large animals in the ocean
Tides are caused by an El Nino

questions.question: What are the highest tides called?

choices.answer: Currents
Nape Tides
Neap Tides
Spring Tides

questions.question: How often do high tides occur?

choices.answer: Every other day during a full moon
Three times a week
Every two weeks during a new moon or full moon
One time per year
Neap Tides
Nape Tides
Spring Tides
Currents

questions.question: How often do neap tides occur?

choices.answer: During the third month of the year
Every other day
During a half moon
During a quarter or three-quarter moon

questions.question: The width of the shoreline strip that is affectedby waves depends on the tidal range.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: If the tidal range is very small, where will all of the wave's energy be concentrated?

choices.answer: Scattered throughout the wave
In the same place
Toward the left side of the wave
Toward the right side of the wave
